Package org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.rank

Class RankConstruction

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractControllableAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditableAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.AbstractComplementConstruction<FSA,​FSA>
org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.rank.RankConstruction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener, ComplementConstruction<FSA,​FSA>, ControllableAlgorithm, EditableAlgorithm
public class RankConstruction
extends AbstractComplementConstruction<FSA,​FSA>
This class provides an implementation of the rank-based construction [KV01, GKSV03, FKV06, Sch09]. Listed below are available options in this implementation.
  • O_MAX_ACC [TFVT10]: Maximize the acceptance condition of the input automaton. This option can but not limited to reduce the range of ranks when #O_RANK_REDUCTION is also enabled.
  • O_RANK_REDUCTION [GKSV03]: With this option, ranks will be in the range [0, 2(n - a)] where n is the number of states of the input automaton and a is the number of accepting states of the input automaton. Otherwise, the range will be [0, 2n]. This option is useful when #O_TIGHT_RANK is disabled.
  • O_DECREMENT_RANK_AT_MOST_BY [KV01]: This option must be a non-negative value k. Consider a state in a run DAG. Assume that the minimal rank among all predecessors of the state is r. If k = 0, the possible ranks of the state will be [0, r]. Otherwise, the possible ranks of the state will be [max(0, r - k), r]. This option is disabled when #O_TIGHT_RANK is enabled.
  • O_TIGHT_RANK [FKV06]: Select only tight level rankings.
  • O_UNCHANGED_ODD_RANK_ALONG_PATH [Sch09]: With this option, the level ranking of a state always has the same rank as the level ranking of any its predecessor has. This option is available only when #O_TIGHT_RANK is enabled.
  • O_TURN_WISE_CUT_POINT [Sch09]: With this option, even ranks are checked turn by turn in the cut-point construction.
  • O_REDUCE_OUTDEGREE [Sch09]: Reduce the number of outgoing transitions. This option is available only when #O_TIGHT_RANK is enabled.
  • O_EXCLUDE_GAMMA4: Omit the transition function γ4 in [Sch09]. This option is applicable only when O_REDUCE_OUTDEGREE is enabled.
  • O_REDUCE_STATES: Remove unreachable and dead states after the rank-based construction finishes.
References:
  • Orna Kupferman, Moshe Y. Vardi: Weak alternating automata are not that weak. ACM Transactions on Computational Logic. 2(3): 408-429 (2001)
  • Sankar Gurumurthy, Orna Kupferman, Fabio Somenzi, Moshe Y. Vardi: On Complementing Nondeterministic BÃ¼chi Automata. CHARME 2003: 96-110
  • Ehud Friedgut, Orna Kupferman, Moshe Y. Vardi: Büchi Complementation Made Tighter. ATVA 2004: 64-78
  • Ehud Friedgut, Orna Kupferman, Moshe Y. Vardi: Büchi Complementation Made Tighter. International Journal of Foundations of Computer Science. 17(4): 851-868 (2006)
  • Sven Schewe: Büchi Complementation Made Tight. STACS 2009: 661-672
  • Ming-Hsien Tsai, Seth Fogarty, Moshe Y. Vardi, Yih-Kuen Tsay: State of Büchi Complementation. CIAA 2010: 261-271
Author:
"Ming-Hsien Tsai"

  • Field Details

    • O_MAX_ACC

      public static final java.lang.String O_MAX_ACC
      The option of maximizing the acceptance condition of the input automaton.

    • O_RANK_REDUCTION

      public static final java.lang.String O_RANK_REDUCTION
      Reduce the range of ranks to [0, 2(n - a)] where n is the number of states of the input automaton and a is the number of accepting states of the input automaton.

    • O_DECREMENT_RANK_AT_MOST_BY

      public static final java.lang.String O_DECREMENT_RANK_AT_MOST_BY
      The amount which the rank of a successor can be smaller then the minimal rank of all its predecessors at most by. This option must be a non-negative value. If the value is 0, then the rank of the successor can be arbitrary smaller than the minimal rank of all its predecessors. Note that this option is disabled when #O_TIGHT_RANK is enabled.

    • O_TIGHT_RANK

      public static final java.lang.String O_TIGHT_RANK
      The option of considering only tight level rankings.

    • O_UNCHANGED_ODD_RANK_ALONG_PATH

      public static final java.lang.String O_UNCHANGED_ODD_RANK_ALONG_PATH
      The option of enforcing that the rank of level rankings along a path never changes. This option is applicable only when #O_TIGHT_RANK is enabled.

    • O_TURN_WISE_CUT_POINT

      public static final java.lang.String O_TURN_WISE_CUT_POINT
      The option of checking even ranks turn by turn in the cut-point construction.

    • O_REDUCE_OUTDEGREE

      public static final java.lang.String O_REDUCE_OUTDEGREE
      The option of reducing outgoing transitions. This option is applicable only when #O_TIGHT_RANK is enabled.

    • O_EXCLUDE_GAMMA4

      public static final java.lang.String O_EXCLUDE_GAMMA4
      The option of excluding γ4 in [Sch09]. This option is applicable only when #O_REDUCE_OUTDEGREE is enabled.

    • O_REDUCE_STATES

      public static final java.lang.String O_REDUCE_STATES
      The option of removing unreachable and dead states after the construction finishes.

    • RANK_STATE

      public static final java.lang.String RANK_STATE
      A key to access the RankState object in a state of the complement. The RankState object is stored in the properties of the state. The properties of a state can be obtained by AbstractEditable.getProperties().
